abstract:
This talk presents a rich data modelling exercise using the latest
functionality provided by PostgreSQL. Our goal is to cover the advances
made by these tools in the past decade and illustrating how they can be
used to model and query big data problems. After all, SQL was the
original "big data" technology. And, while SQL has fallen out of the
hype cycle, it remains a powerful, sophisticated, and mature technology
for solving real-world business problems.

The talk will propose a "data-first" strategy for modelling business
problems and illustrate how to advanced SQL functionality can help
enforce constraints and implement business logic in a safe, simple, and
robust way.
description:
Sure, party like it's 1999, but maybe let's not write SQL like it's
1992? Yeah, 1992 was a great year—Boyz II Men, Red Hot Chili Peppers,
TLC—but you're missing a lot if you haven't updated your playlist since
then. And not just Beyoncé, Rihanna, and Drake, but also SQL99, SQL03,
SQL06, SQL08, SQL11, SQL16—common table expressions, window functions,
full temporality, table inheritance, and more…!
title: Let's SQL Like It's 1992!
